thread.title: Dentist who killed Cecil the Lion won't be charged
thread.title_full: Dentist who killed Cecil the Lion won't be charged | www.ajc.com

author: Katie Link
title: Dentist who killed Cecil the Lion won't be charged
text:
Walter Palmer has officially escaped extradition. Months after the American dentist took down Cecil the Lion in Zimbabwe, officials there have announced he's cleared of any charges. (Video via WCCO )
Cecil was a hugely popular cat at a national park in western Zimbabwe. Palmer wounded the lion with a bow and arrow before killing him with a gun. (Video via Cecil The Lion )
>> RELATED: 7 things from hunterâ€™s interview about killing Cecil the Lion
Jim Mone / AP In this Sept. 8, 2015, file photo, dentist Walter Palmer arrives at his office following a lunch break in Bloomington, Minn. A Zimbabwe Cabinet minister said Oct. 12, 2015, that the country is no longer pressing for Palmer's extradition following the hunting and killing a well-known lion called Cecil. Public outrage may have led Zimbabwean officials to talk a big talk. Once news of the killing came to light, the country's environment minister promised to extradite Palmer and charge him in Cecil's home country. (Video via KSTP )
There is an extradition treaty in place between the U.S. and Zimbabwe, which makes it possible to extradite a person who commits a crime that's illegal in both countries, so technically, it could have happened.
>> RELATED: Cecil the Lion's hunter to return to work
But from the get-go, Palmer has sworn the hunt was legal and all of his permits were in order. On Monday, the environment minister agreed.
Palmer's Zimbabwean hunting guide, on the other hand, still faces charges for "failing to prevent an illegal hunt."
>> Read more trending stories
The country says Palmer can return to Zimbabwe as a tourist any time.
This video includes images from Getty Images.
